description.narrative: The Decentralized Rural Infrastructure Project for Peru aims at improving access of rural households and entrepreneurs to goods, social services and income generating opportunities through reduced transport costs and better rural transport infrastructure and through piloting, in 15 provinces, specific incentives aiming at promoting greater complementarities and bundling of rural infrastructure interventions at the provincial level. The closing date for the project will be extended from March 31, 2012 until March 31, 2013. The project has been implemented at a relatively accelerated pace and has currently disbursed US$42.8million (86 percent of the Loan amount of US$50 million). Civil works, in particular for the rehabilitation component, have been implemented at 93 percent of completion rate while institutional strengthening activities have been slower at 62 percent for the development of the local capacity and 23 percent in policy and regulation. The project has been impacted in recent years due to the regional and national elections that took place (in 2010 and 2011) resulting in a significant number of changes in provincial administrations, including changes in technical staff of the Provincial Road Institutes. The extension is necessary to allow for the project activities to be completed and achieve its objectives during the proposed extended implementation period. The Borrower has in place an action plan to monitor project progress and complete the project by March 31, 2013. This will be the first extension of the project.

325 new micro-enterprises were created and implemented. Therefore, the total number of micro-enterprises that are currentlyoperating is 857.

title.narrative: Non-motorized tracks rehabilitated by the program
Selected Provincial Infrastructure Institutes fully operational

comment.narrative: Instead of putting in place the PIIs, the Borrower prioritized the creation and expansion of PRIs, reaching 193, which exceededtheoriginal target of 150 (see indicator 10)

title.narrative: Bridges rehabilitated and maintained by the program

comment.narrative: One bridge has been rehabilitated (in Ancash).

title.narrative: Resources dedicated by Provincial and District municipalities to rural transport activities

comment.narrative: Starting in 2007, the central Government has assigned US$ 140 million for periodic and routine maintenance. In 2011, it assignedanadditional US$ 109 million for the same activities.

title.narrative: Rural roads periodically maintained at project standards

comment.narrative: The end target was successfully achieved and exceeded before closing date.

title.narrative: Rural infrastructure plans prepared and approved

comment.narrative: The end target was successfully achieved before closing date.

title.narrative: Selected Participatory Provincial Road plans approved

comment.narrative: The target was successfully achieved and exceeded (one Province did not continue with the project even after the plan was alreadycreated).

title.narrative: One-year equivalent permanent unskilled jobs generated by micro-enterprises

comment.narrative: The target was successfully achieved and exceeded. Employment has been generated for 1,610 women and 4,140 men.

title.narrative: Selected provinces where rural infrastructure investments prioritized by rural infrastructure plans have been implemented

comment.narrative: This target was not directly achieved. The Government decided to implement the RIP through MIDIS/FONIE.

title.narrative: Productive activities financed and implemented through the LDW / Number of activities identified and assessed

comment.narrative: 46 small business private initiatives were implemented and 52 business plans were financed through 210 identified and assessed.
The end target was successfully achieved and exceeded, 193 PRIs are fully operational.
